page.title: 04A POPULAR LEISURE ACTIVITY
page.content: In the whole of our class of 26, 10 of us go horse riding. This is because there are riding stables in Curridge, and we have some lovely countryside, to ride in. It costs Â£5 for a lesson and Â£4 for an hour. You can have a day ride for Â£14. Full livery is when you have your own pony at the stables and nobody else can ride it. This costs Â£800 per year, or you can have it on half livery at half the cost. When the summer comes the owner cuts the ponies' manes and tails so they don't get too hot. The horses are re-shod every six months. The old shoes are often given to people who think it is lucky. it is fun riding because you can see everything, but sometimes you get a sore bottom.
